reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Integrated rural development in the middle basin of the Nizaito River, Municipality of Paradise, Province Barahona, Dominican Republic: conservation, sustainable management and use of natural resources

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes Fundación para el Desarrollo y la Protección de la Cuenca del Río Nizaíto en Paraíso (FUNDEPROCUNIPA), $223,230 over three years. FUNDEPROCUNIPA will provide training, technical assistance and agricultural materials to at least 600 low-income Haitian and Dominican farmers from six communities in the municipality of Paraíso in the Dominican Republic. The project will support new and sustainable eco-farming practices; develop small scale animal husbandry; and improve the quality of the Nizaíto River..

participating-org.narrative: Fundación para el Desarrollo y la Protección de la Cuenca del Río Nizaíto en Paraíso
The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

mailing-address.narrative: 1331 Pennsylvania Ave. NW, Suite 1200 NorthÂ Washington, DC 20004

description.narrative: U.S. assistance supports the foreign policy priority of building the Dominican Republic's effectiveness as a regional partner, and is aligned with the priorities established in the Dominican National Development Strategy. A challenging security environment, climate change, weak institutions, corruption, inadequate public health services, poor education, and a lack of job opportunities are major development challenges facing the Dominican Republic. The U.S. government collaborates with Dominican authorities to address these challenges, while working with local and international partners to strengthen institutional and technical capacity. A secure and stable Dominican Republic is important to the advancement of U.S. interests in the Caribbean. The FY 2017 foreign assistance request aims to build resilience to the effects of climate change, improve the quality of basic education, and increase access to quality prevention, care, and treatment services for HIV/AIDS. To address the needs of marginalized populations, including women, the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and intersex (LGBTI) community, people of Haitian descent, and people with disabilities, U.S. assistance will fund activities to support their inclusion in all aspects of Dominican society. Bilateral programs will complement and enhance security and citizen safety assistance being provided through the Caribbean Basin Security Initiative.
